Data: 10.50am Cameron White has won the toss in his first ODI as captain and Australia will bat.
Anderson to Paine, no run full and straight to begin with, Paine defends
Anderson to Paine, 1 wide oops, this one goes down leg and doesn't swing back - it's called a wide
Anderson to Paine, 1 run another one swings down leg but this time Paine clips it through square to get off the mark
Anderson to Haddin, no run good ball, swinging away from Haddin, and it goes through to Steve Davies, who has the gloves on instead of Matt Prior

Anderson to Haddin, no run dropped at second slip! Anderson draws a genuine edge from Haddin, Yardy dives across to his left, across in front of Strauss, but grasses the chance. That should have been taken, but it was probably the skipper's catch
Anderson to Haddin, no run left alone outside off
Anderson to Haddin, 1 run banged in at the hips and Haddin gets off the mark with a single worked to square leg
Plunkett to Haddin, 1 run Plunkett begins with a straight ball and Haddin flicks it through midwicket
Plunkett to Paine, 3 runs good placement from Paine as Plunkett goes a touch too straight again, Paine just clips it into the gap between midwicket and mid-on, not trying to hit it too hard
Plunkett to Haddin, 2 runs fullish and wide of off, Haddin jams the bat down to drive square through point
Plunkett to Haddin, 1 wide wrong line, well down leg side
Plunkett to Haddin, no run better line now as Plunkett goes just outside off and angles it back in a touch, it's left alone
Plunkett to Haddin, 1 wide another wide down leg side - both bowlers have battled to get the right line so far today
Plunkett to Haddin, no run punched to mid-off and can't find the gap
Plunkett to Haddin, no run straighter ball now and it's defended away to the off side
Anderson to Paine, 1 run again Anderson picks up a thick edge, this one from Paine flies through where a fourth slip might have been, and it runs away to third man

Anderson to Haddin, FOUR runs Haddin loves that shot! He backs away just a fraction and slams it inside out over cover for the first boundary of the match - a touch risky, perhaps, but he's hit that one well enough
Anderson to Haddin, no run fuller and straighter now and Haddin drives, but can't beat mid-off
Anderson to Haddin, no run straight-bat defence from Haddin
Anderson to Haddin, no run a bit of width from Anderson and Haddin cuts hard, but straight to point
Anderson to Haddin, no run another one cut straight to point
Plunkett to Paine, no run defended to the leg side
Plunkett to Paine, no run ooh, another leading edge this time from Paine as he tries to flick to leg and it lobs safely short of the man at cover

Plunkett to Paine, OUT ah, now, we have a review that could be for both caught and lbw. Paine was walking down the pitch and tried to flick the ball to leg, it's hit him on the pad and lobbed out to cover, where the catch has been taken. So England want to know if it's either lbw or caught, which Paul Reiffel decides a
Plunkett to Ferguson, no run defends it away safely
Plunkett to Ferguson, no run straight bat from Ferguson as he pushes it back to Plunkett
Plunkett to Ferguson, 1 run clipped away off the pads for a single to fine leg
Anderson to Ferguson, no run on the back foot now, Ferguson punches to mid-off
Anderson to Ferguson, no run full and straight, no swing this time from Anderson, and Ferguson defends
Anderson to Ferguson, 1 leg bye swinging down leg there and would have been a wide, but it's slammed into Ferguson's pad and run away for a leg bye
Anderson to Haddin, no run solidly defended by Haddin, who is one of the few senior players in this Australian side today
Anderson to Haddin, no run pushed away to the leg side this time
Anderson to Haddin, no run Haddin watchfully defends again - he'd love a big innings going in to the World Cup
Plunkett to Ferguson, no run pushed away defensively to the off side
Plunkett to Ferguson, no run good bounce and carry through to Davies as this one beats the bat of Ferguson
Plunkett to Ferguson, FOUR runs good shot from Ferguson as he gets a full and straight one and flicks it confidently through square leg, all the way along the ground for his first boundary
Plunkett to Ferguson, no run solidly defended to the off side now
Plunkett to Ferguson, no run banged in at the hips and Ferguson works it to midwicket
Plunkett to Ferguson, 1 run clipped away through mid-on and this one finds the gap
Anderson to Ferguson, no run straight-bat defence from Ferguson now as he pushes it back to Anderson
Anderson to Ferguson, no run banged in a touch shorter now and Ferguson sways out of the way
Anderson to Ferguson, no run struck on the pads now as it swings down leg and Ferguson can't get it away
Anderson to Ferguson, 1 run quick single now as Ferguson gets on the back foot and punches it to mid-off
Anderson to Haddin, 1 leg bye another one swings away down the leg side, and again it's not put away, Haddin can only get pad on this and it dribbles away to the on side
Anderson to Ferguson, no run again Ferguson is on the back foot, punching an accurate Anderson delivery to mid-off
Finn to Haddin, 1 run he begins with a half-volley that Haddin pushes to cover for a quick single
Finn to Ferguson, no run another half-volley from Finn, whose run-up is ever so McGrath-like, and Ferguson pushes to mid-off
Finn to Ferguson, FOUR runs Ferguson frees himself up now and gets a much-needed boundary as he backs off a fraction and forces a cut through point, it runs away to the boundary
Finn to Ferguson, no run defended back down the pitch

Finn to Ferguson, FOUR runs and there's another boundary from Ferguson, really good wristy stuff as he flicks one off the leg-stump line through midwicket and it's run all the way along the ground, well timed and placed
Finn to Ferguson, no run fuller and straighter, and Ferguson blocks it
Anderson to Haddin, no run good probing line outside off and Haddin just defends to point

Anderson to Haddin, no run Haddin isn't really middling the ball today, and he's moved across outside leg a touch and tried to force it down the ground, but gets an inside edge into his right leg, in a bit of pain there as it got the unpadded section
Anderson to Haddin, no run banged in shorter now and Haddin leaves it alone
Anderson to Haddin, 1 run again Haddin gives himself room but then just checks his shot and nudges it behind point

Anderson to Ferguson, OUT Ferguson is gone! Good ball from Anderson as this one bounces sharply outside off and Ferguson fends, and it's well taken high and to the right of Strauss, the only slip in place. Ferguson probably didn't have to play at that bouncer - it wasn't aimed at the body.
Anderson to White, no run banged in at the body and White nudges to leg
Finn to Haddin, no run full and straight and Haddin meets it with a good on-drive, but straight to mid-on
Finn to Haddin, 1 run this one's more gently driven down to mid-on and that allows Haddin to hurry a single
Finn to White, no run Finn aiming to hit the top of off stump here and White defends with a dead bat
Finn to White, no run banged in short of a length now and White defends
Finn to White, no run again Finn is hitting the corridor just on or a touch outside off - White meets it with a straight bat
Finn to White, no run fuller and a little straighter, White defends to mid-on

Anderson to Haddin, SIX runs Haddin middles this one! And he's smashed it over mid-off for the first six of the match. What a good stroke, he's cleared the fence and that will give him some confidence
Anderson to Haddin, no run Haddin backs away a little and it's beaten him, through to Davies
Anderson to Haddin, no run short of a length again and Haddin defends
Anderson to Haddin, 1 run swivels a pull away behind square leg now but this is just a single
Anderson to White, 1 run White gets himself off the mark now, glancing a bad ball down leg and Finn at fine leg slides across to save the boundary
Anderson to Haddin, no run ah, nasty delivery now that jags back in and bounces sharply, it flies off the hip - and possibly bat - and lobs safely short of the man at short fine leg
Finn to White, no run Finn is banging it in short of a length here but not getting much bounce - White angles the bat and pushes to gully
Finn to White, no run this one bounces more, and White defends off the back foot
Finn to White, no run nudged away towards cover and White can't find a gap
Finn to White, no run again White nudges to off, no run there
Finn to White, no run ah, great bouncer as it's well directed and White is in all sorts of bother trying to get away from this - it's whacked the shoulder of the bat, just in front of the helmet
Finn to White, no run banged in shortish again and White can't get it away
Plunkett to Haddin, no run again Haddin backs away, as he is wont to do, and it's a swing and a miss
Plunkett to Haddin, no run nudges it away towards point and can't find a run
Plunkett to Haddin, 1 run this time Haddin gets it off the middle, as he tries to thump it over cover, but a man in the deep cuts it off

Plunkett to White, no run cracking save by Bell at gully! White lashed this cut into the ground and for all money that looked to have beaten Bell, who hurled himself to his left and just got his hand to it
Plunkett to White, 1 run pushed gently towards mid-on now and White does get a single this time
Plunkett to Haddin, 1 leg bye angling a touch down leg and Haddin can't get it away properly, just getting one wide of Davies
Finn to Haddin, no run Finn continues to bowl well, and Haddin can only push it jumpily to gully
Finn to Haddin, no run straighter and angling in a touch, Haddin defends

Finn to Haddin, no run yet another leading edge, and Haddin is very lucky to get away with this. He's shaped to pull, but then stopped halfway through it and the ball has lobbed off his edge short of point
Finn to Haddin, 1 run tucked away off the hips for a single
Finn to White, no run White defends again and can't get a single

Finn to White, FOUR runs hmmm, a boundary, and pretty well played in the end. White has changed his shot halfway through playing it, shaping to pull and then deciding to guide it uppishly wide of the sole slip and it races away to third-man for a boundary. Second slip could have snaffled that, if there was one.
Plunkett to Haddin, 1 run flicked away through square leg for a single
Plunkett to White, 1 run
Plunkett to Haddin, no run Haddin again backs away and tries to swipe it through cover, but it bounces over the stumps and through to Davies
Plunkett to Haddin, 1 run oh dear, a top edge now as Haddin goes for the pull, and he's again lucky that this one doesn't carry, it falls short of mid-on
Plunkett to White, no run nudged away to the off side

Plunkett to White, no run England want a review for an lbw shout that is turned down, but this looked to be angling down leg, if there wasn't an inside edge. Let's see. And yes indeed, that was a big inside edge, so the decision stands. Strange that it was reviewed, as none of the England players really went up for th
Finn to Haddin, no run Finn rams one in back of a length, as has been England's way today, and Haddin as usual skips leg side of the ball to defend on his toes to cover

Finn to Haddin, 1 leg bye dropped by Davies! Oh, no, apparently it's a legbye. Top delivery, turned Haddin right around, flicked the back thigh pad and Davies put down the non-chance diving to his right
Finn to White, no run good lengths and lines for Finn, enjoying the trampoline bounce and White as usual has the most horridly stiff wrists and cannot work the ball in defence
Finn to White, no run another clunked back-foot defence. England like it up at White, who doesn't appear to enjoy it
Finn to White, 1 run this is short again and finally White wheels away a stiff-armed pull shot that trickles down to fine leg
Finn to Haddin, no run Haddin continues his exhibition of self-restraint by drawing his bat inside the line and flagging this through to Davies
Plunkett to White, 1 run Plunkett working up some decent wheels with his horridly clunky action and White manages somehow to squeeze this out to third man, half-guide half-cut shot
Plunkett to Haddin, 1 wide oops, shoved down the leg side and Plunkett will have to bowl this again
Plunkett to Haddin, no run back onto a fine line, hugging off stump and meeting the patient straight bat of Haddin
Plunkett to Haddin, 1 run a touch too straight from Plunkett and it's worked around the corner
Plunkett to White, 1 run Plunkett not following the short-ball plan to White, instead opting for its spiritual opposite - the yorker - which is slightly undercooked and flicked to the leg side
Plunkett to Haddin, 1 wide a good short ball that bounces up around off stump is given a wide. It's because bowlers aren't allowed to be threatening in ODI cricket
Plunkett to Haddin, 1 run this is turning into a lengthy over but Plunkett hasn't actually bowled that badly and this is pushed to cover for a swift single
Plunkett to White, no run good finish to the over, Plunkett bangs it in short of a length and White has to stand up to defend uncomfortably

Finn to Haddin, 1 run Finn, who is looking oddly orange today, bangs in a short ball that is dropped into the leg side and Finn hares off after it to field. One of the few people still enthusiastic about this seven-match trudge of a series
Finn to White, 1 run shortish again and White is resolute in defence, pushing square of the wicket
Finn to Haddin, no run slower ball from the orangeman, who is not Celtic, as far as I know, well directed too and Haddin defends
Finn to Haddin, no run quicker this time and it darts past Haddin's attempted back cut
Finn to Haddin, no run excellent lines and lengths from Haddin, who seems to wear a permanent smile, or smirk if you're English, defends carefully
Finn to Haddin, no run left alone outside off stump to finish the over
Wright to White, no run starts well, full of bounding enthusiasm and potential incompetence, on middle and defended
Wright to White, 1 run similar delivery to the last and White turns his heavy wrists over the ball to midwicket
Wright to Haddin, no run Wright lands another good delivery, following Haddin as he backed away, and it's defended back to the bowler
Wright to Haddin, 1 wide this is slipped down the leg side, and no amount of bright-eyed apology can stop this being a wide
Wright to Haddin, 1 leg bye leg-sided again and it thudded off the pads and trickled into the leg side
Wright to White, 1 run fullish and straightish and not much the batsman can do but defend
Wright to Haddin, 1 run Haddin as usual backs away and this gives him the room to steer behind point
Yardy to Haddin, no run starts well enough, straight, no sign of turn and it's pushed back to the bowler
Yardy to Haddin, 1 run very short from Yardy, that earns a hint of turn and Haddin has to wait a long, long time to cut to deep point
Yardy to White, 1 leg bye White is the sort of man that could stand tall and smash this out of Perth, instead he gets down apologetically on one-knee and misses a ramp-sweep. Awful that

Yardy to Haddin, OUT smart work from Finn on the long-on boundary sees the end of Haddin! Poor shot really, he just lifted the ball without much intent towards Finn on the boundary, who back-pedalled to take the catch, felt himself about to go over the rope to through the ball up, stepped over before coming back and c
Yardy to White, no run more careful defence from White, who has remodelled himself on Boycott
Yardy to White, 1 run yet again White is on the paddle-sweep, he's so tall and bulky it makes no sense, but there you go. He gets enough to earn a single around the corner
Wright to White, 1 run White really does hare in, his run up is hilariously quicker than his bowling, the line is good though and it's pushed to mid-on
Wright to Hussey, no run more good discipline from Wright and Hussey, another who likes to stand leg-side of the ball, defends to cover
Wright to Hussey, no run left alone outside off stump

Wright to Hussey, FOUR runs for no good reason Wright imagines he has pace and bangs this in short, he doesn't so it sits up invitingly and Hussey does the necessary, thumping this a long way in front of square for four
Wright to Hussey, no run dropped by Wright, excellent slower ball and Hussey popped it up back to the bowler, they are never easy etc etc, but it should have been taken
Wright to Hussey, 1 run Hussey celebrates his let-off in typically measured Hussey fashion, working a single behind square on the off side
Yardy to Hussey, 1 run flight! Flight form Yardy! It's nudged around the corner
Yardy to White, no run this is less flighted but the line is good and White's stiff arms can't work a single
Yardy to White, 1 run full toss is carefully pushed down the ground
Yardy to Hussey, 2 runs wonderful fielding from Plunkett on the square leg boundary saves the four, it was firmly pulled from Hussey and deserved four
Yardy to Hussey, 1 run short again and it's pulled with less power for a single
Yardy to White, 1 run pushed into the off side carefully for a single
Wright to White, 1 wide adverts interrupted this delivery, so I'm not entirely sure what happened. Send your complaints to the BCCI, who should prevent this from happening
Wright to White, 1 run ooh, Wright lands this slightly short and the batsman lifted it back towards the bowler who stuck out a hand speculatively but it past him
Wright to Hussey, no run fuller and straighter and it's carefully defended
Wright to Hussey, 1 run the line drifts a touch to leg and it's worked off the pads for one
Wright to White, no run again this is shortish and at the body, nudged into the leg side
Wright to White, 1 run this time White picks it off into the leg side for another single
Wright to Hussey, no run the over finishes with Hussey pushing to cover
Yardy to White, no run touch short form Yardy but the late cut finds the fielder
Yardy to White, 1 run White edges down the wicket and works down the ground
Yardy to Hussey, 1 run again it's pushed down the ground for another single
Yardy to White, 1 run the sound of time passing slowly - Yardy pushed gently down to long-on
Yardy to Hussey, SIX runs bang! Good grief, to paraphrase Mark Nicholas. Yardy was a touch short and this Hussey got deep into his crease and mowed this into the stands over deep midwicket
Yardy to Hussey, no run defended to finish the over
Wright to White, no run Wright finds an off-stump line and it's defended
Wright to White, 2 runs short again, the last occasion White timed the ball was a year ago I think, so his attempted pull is spooned over midwicket
Wright to White, no run White sits on the back foot and full-faces back to the bowler
Wright to White, 1 run touch too leg-sided allows White to turns his hands over the ball

Wright to Hussey, no run direct hit would have had Hussey out! It was played out to Bell who dived at cover to field smartly, Hussey was still half-way down trying to turn but Bell's throw was well wide
Wright to Hussey, 1 run no alarm here, just nudged around the corner
Yardy to Hussey, 1 run Yardy darts this into the pads and it's flicked away for an easy single
Yardy to White, OUT Yardy has another! White tortuous innings ends. White edged down the track but only to bunt this with plenty of inside-edge back to Yardy who gleefully held on to the chance
Yardy to Voges, no run wow, Yardy finds turn, actual spin past a dangling outside edge
Yardy to Voges, no run pushed back to the bowler who fields and aims to throw back at the batsman
Yardy to Voges, no run more careful defence from the front foot
Yardy to Voges, no run a final forward-block to finish the over
Plunkett to Hussey, FOUR runs starts with a decent delivery around off stump but Hussey gets leg-side of the ball and opens the face to guide it to third man for four
Plunkett to Hussey, no run fuller and firmly pushed back to the bowler
Plunkett to Hussey, FOUR runs ah top shot again, Hussey gets a touch of width and crashes this backwards of point
Plunkett to Hussey, 1 run yikes, Plunkett has lost his line and length completely and it's cut again firmly but this time to deep cover
Plunkett to Voges, no run better delivery here - full and straight - and defended back to the bowler
Plunkett to Voges, 1 run hint of extra bounce finds the outside edge and flies off down to third man to finish a good over for Australia
Yardy to Voges, no run Voges wants to have a dart but Yardy is cramping his for room
Yardy to Voges, 3 runs Voges down the wicket again and Yardy responded by dropping it shorter, Voges adjusted by cutting very hard to point
Yardy to Hussey, no run this is a touch leg-sided and clips the pads
Yardy to Hussey, 1 run more of a bat on this and it's driven down the ground
Yardy to Voges, no run pushed into the on side
Yardy to Voges, FOUR runs excellent flick, fine around the corner earns four, really well played
Plunkett to Hussey, 1 wide Plunkett gets his line wrong, shoving this down the leg side
Plunkett to Hussey, 1 run Hussey bunts this gently into the legside and Plunkett runs around to field
Plunkett to Voges, 1 run short ball and Voges doesn't get much of a pull shot so it trickles away
Plunkett to Hussey, 1 run short and legsided again and once again the pull shot isn't timed all that well
Plunkett to Voges, no run good delivery here, hugging off stump and it's blocked
Plunkett to Voges, 1 wide banged in short, but too short and it sails way over the batsman
Plunkett to Voges, 1 run Plunkett adjusts his line and finds a fuller length, rewarded with an outside edge that runs down to third man
Plunkett to Hussey, no run finishes the over with a full and straight ball that is pushed back to the bowler who fields and throws the ball back at the keeper
Yardy to Voges, 1 run Yardy gets his line wrong and is turned around the corner for a single
Yardy to Hussey, no run full and straight and pushed into the off side
Yardy to Hussey, 1 run pushed wide of cover
Yardy to Voges, 1 run Yardy trundles in and is milked down the ground
Yardy to Hussey, 2 runs Hussey gets deep in his crease to steer a full ball past cover
Yardy to Hussey, 1 run Hussey carefully watches this onto the bat and guides it away for a single
Trott to Hussey, 1 run quality start from Trott, he's done this slow-medium very well this tour, and it's carefully defended
Trott to Voges, FOUR runs wow, good timing here, Trott gets his line wrong and it's flicked through midwicket for four
Trott to Voges, 1 run this is worked to midwicket again but this time just for one
Trott to Hussey, 4 leg byes Trott gets his line wrong again, and it's far too full for Davies to get hold of, flicked off the pad down to the fine leg rope
Trott to Hussey, 1 run this time the line is better and it's pushed down the ground
Trott to Voges, 1 run full and straight again and pushed down the ground for a jogged single
Yardy to Voges, 2 runs this skews off an inside edge into the midwicket region
Yardy to Voges, no run worked again into the leg side but no run
Yardy to Voges, 2 runs good running earns this guide past over for two
Yardy to Voges, 1 run shortish and it's hit to midwicket
Yardy to Hussey, no run careful defence off the front foot
Yardy to Hussey, 1 run pushed straight to cover for a rapid single to bring up the 150
Wright to Hussey, 1 run full and on the legs, turned around the corner
Wright to Voges, 1 wide this is shortish and shoved down the leg side
Wright to Voges, 1 run good, bustling back-of-a-length delivery is dropped into the off side for a sharp single
Wright to Hussey, no run slower ball finds the inside edge of a flowing drive and it runs out to midwicket
Wright to Hussey, no run another slower ball is driven to mid-off
Wright to Hussey, FOUR runs french-cut gets the boundary! Nips back, flicks an inside edge that runs past the stumps and past the diving Davies
Wright to Hussey, 1 run pushed to cover for a quick single to finish the over
Yardy to Hussey, FOUR runs Yardy finds a good line but some wonderful timing from a forward-push sees the ball racing to the cover boundary. This partnership has been superb
Yardy to Hussey, no run defended back to the bowler
Yardy to Hussey, 1 run again it's pushed back at the bowler but a diving Yardy can't cut off the single
Yardy to Voges, no run touch of inside edge trickles back to the bowler
Yardy to Voges, 1 run worked off the pads to midwicket
Yardy to Hussey, 1 run defended off the front foot, with an inside edge, runs to midwicket to bring up a superb 50
Wright to Hussey, 1 run flicked away through square leg
Wright to Voges, no run nudged away defensively by Voges
Wright to Voges, 2 runs lofted over midwicket now and it's just lobbed short of the man in the deep, a chip shot really

Wright to Voges, 3 runs lovely cut shot as Wright gives Voges some width, and Yardy running around from third man stops this with his foot - he's obviously not keen on the dive! Good way to break an ankle, though, if you get it wrong
Wright to Hussey, 1 run again too short from Wright, and Hussey pulls to deep midwicket on the bounce
Wright to Voges, 2 runs good stuff from Hussey and Voges here, another quick single pushed to cover - and in fact, that has become two, as England get a bit sloppy and allow an overthrow
Finn to Hussey, no run clipped away to leg and can't find a run
Finn to Hussey, 1 run cut down into the ground and it runs away past Davies to third man, but is cut off and they can only manage a single
Finn to Voges, FOUR runs beautiful cut by Voges! He's waited, cut late and timed it so well that third man can't save it with a sprawling dive to his right, that's a really great stroke
Finn to Voges, 1 run banged in at the hips now and Voges tucks a run through square leg
Finn to Hussey, 1 run tickled down towards fine leg now for another run
Finn to Voges, 1 run turned off his pads through square leg again
Wright to Voges, 1 run Wright strays on to the pads too much, and Voges flicks a single down to fine leg
Wright to Hussey, no run a touch slower from Wright and Hussey can't get it away, a stifled shout as this hits the pads but it was way outside leg
Wright to Hussey, 1 run Wright is down leg once more, and Hussey once again tucks a single to fine leg - the scoreboard keeps ticking over
Wright to Voges, 1 run too straight - Wright needs to get across just a tad outside off - and Voges clips another one through square leg
Wright to Hussey, no run better line this time and Hussey defends to the off side

Wright to Hussey, 2 runs Hussey goes for the cut now and gets it through point, and that's superb running as they sprint back for two, Hussey narrowly beating a slightly wide throw from Plunkett that is collected by Davies. A better throw and it would have been tight.
Finn to Voges, no run Voges clunks a drive into the ground and back to Finn
Finn to Voges, FOUR runs brilliant late cut! Voges played that same shot in the last over for the same result - this one was even crisper, sailing along the turf and beating third man comfortably.
Finn to Voges, no run straighter line from Finn now and Voges nudges to off, thinks of a quick single, and decides against it
Finn to Voges, 1 run Finn goes a little too straight now and Voges tickles a single down to fine leg
Finn to Hussey, no run defended back down the pitch
Finn to Hussey, 1 wide wrong line and this is called a wide as Hussey doesn't get anything on an attempted glance

Wright to Hussey, no run half a shout for lbw as Hussey plays across the line, trying to work it to leg and the ball lobs off his pad to the off side. Wright didn't go through with the appeal, and that was sliding down leg
Wright to Hussey, no run Hussey meets this with the full face of the bat, trying for a punchy drive past the bowler but Wright hurls himself to his left to save the run
Wright to Hussey, 1 run another whippy clip through midwicket, which is a shot Hussey plays a lot. It's not graceful, but it's effective
Wright to Voges, no run pushed away to cover and Voges can't get a run
Wright to Voges, 1 run straight ball from Wright and Voges turns it off his hips through square leg
Wright to Hussey, 1 run really good, quick running as Hussey nudges to short midwicket and takes off - they picked their fieldsman there, as it was Matt Prior

Plunkett to Hussey, OUT Plunkett strikes! Hussey tries to turn this one to leg but it's bounced a touch more than he expected and lobbed off the shoulder of the bat towards point, where Bell takes a smart catch diving forward
Plunkett to Johnson, no run pushed away to point and Johnson can't find a gap
Plunkett to Johnson, no run defended back down the pitch by Johnson
Plunkett to Johnson, 1 run he's off the mark now with a flick to midwicket and Prior's throw misses at the striker's end, where Voges was diving and had made his ground in any case
Plunkett to Voges, 1 run good sharp running again, Voges pushes forward of point and this throw from Bell does hit the stumps at the non-striker's end but the fast Voges makes it home
Plunkett to Johnson, 2 runs well played by Johnson, turns this through midwicket gently to pick up a couple more runs
Anderson to Voges, 2 runs Voges works it along the ground through midwicket and again it's good running to collect two more
Anderson to Voges, 1 run fullish and straight, and Voges punches a drive to mid-off

Anderson to Johnson, 2 runs high, high, higgggh chance from Johnson! And Finn has missed it! Johnson has tried to whack Anderson over midwicket a big leading edge flies a long way up and Finn at short third man runs back, swirls around and totally misjudges it, not an easy one at all
Anderson to Johnson, no run driven clunkily back to Anderson

Anderson to Johnson, OUT Prior has taken a stunner in the deep! Oh, he can catch it without gloves after all! Johnson swung from the hips, trying to clear the boundary at midwicket, and Prior was about 10 metres inside, then backed back and leapt high to take the catch above his head - terrific catch.
Anderson to Voges, 2 runs pulled through midwicket for a couple
Finn to Hastings, 1 wide Hastings walks across towards leg and this one sails down the leg side - wide is called
Finn to Hastings, 1 run good bouncer - well-directed, and Hastings can only fend this away for a run
Finn to Voges, 1 wide once again Finn is tricked by the wandering of Voges, who backs off, then walks across outside leg and tries to hook a ball that Finn speared down leg. Wide called.
Finn to Voges, 2 runs slower ball from Finn, who decides just to bowl straight, and Voges cuts hard for two runs as Bell at point knocks it down without taking it cleanly
Finn to Voges, 1 run Voges backs away a little and punches it back past Finn for a single
Finn to Hastings, FOUR runs a valuable boundary now as Finn goes down leg once more, and Hastings glances it fine enough to beat the man at fine leg, who makes a desperate but unsuccessful slide
Finn to Hastings, 1 run slower ball from Finn, and Hastings nudges a single to the leg side
Finn to Voges, 1 run punched down the ground for a single to long-off
Wright to Voges, no run fullish and straight from Wright, and the drive from Voges finds mid-on
Wright to Voges, no run flicked to mid-on and can't find a run
Wright to Voges, 2 runs this time Voges does find a gap, flicking it through midwicket
Wright to Voges, 1 run Voges tickles this one behind square leg and there are big cheers from his home crowd at the WACA as he brings up his fifty
Wright to Johnson, no run defended away safely
Wright to Johnson, 1 run punched through cover for a comfortable single
Plunkett to Johnson, 1 run flicked off the hips of Johnson, who will get his eye in for a couple of overs before they think about the Powerplay
Plunkett to Voges, no run Voges defends this with a straight bat
Plunkett to Voges, 2 runs a little too short from Plunkett and Voges is quickly on to this pull, along the ground to deep midwicket for two more
Plunkett to Voges, no run guides this cut to gully and can't beat Bell
Plunkett to Voges, no run good line from Plunkett, giving Voges no width, and it's defended
Plunkett to Voges, 1 run again Voges gets the late cut away but third man is wider now to cut off those boundaries
Anderson to Voges, 2 runs clipped high over midwicket now, more like a chip shot as it lands short of the man in the deep
Anderson to Voges, 2 runs driven uppishly towards long-on now and and lands safely again, they hare back for a couple more
Anderson to Voges, 1 wide another England wide, slipped down the leg side
Anderson to Voges, 1 run a touch leg-sided again and swung to fine leg
Anderson to Hastings, OUT Hastings backed away without looking too sure of what he was doing, Anderson banged it in a touch shorter and a thickish top edge looped out to cover

Anderson to Voges, 2 runs slower bouncer is wheeled away to deep midwicket and then there is sudden alarm as the batsmen come back for two, not sure how they made it but in the end it was clearly home
Anderson to Voges, 2 runs Voges backs away and Anderson lands another slow bouncer that is swatted in front of midwicket to end, finally, Anderson's bowling in Australia. He's had an incredible tour
Finn to Krejza, 1 wide Finn starts the final over by shoving it down the leg side for another wide
Finn to Krejza, 2 wide how long will this over last!? Banged in short and it sails over the batsman, Davies just about gets a hand on it so they run byes as well
Finn to Voges, 2 runs slower ball but crucially it's straight, bunted to mid-on and some very swift running turns one into two
Finn to Voges, 1 run slower ball dragged from outside off stump into the leg side but just for a single this time
Finn to Krejza, 2 runs another slower ball but this time Krejza got all of it and it's crunched to deep point
Finn to Krejza, 2 runs big mow from a length ball skews off the inside edge into the midwicket region
Finn to Krejza, 2 runs the final ball is sliced over the infield down to deep long-off, Voges finishes unbeaten on 80

Very good recovery from Australia puts them in charge. England were impressive at times and tawdry at others. 19 wides tells you all you need to know, Australia have probably 19 too many. Andrew McGlashan will have a bulletin ready shortly and we'll be back in about 30mins. In the meantime check out our YouTube channel.
Right, no time for dawdling the innings is about to start again. Tait to Strauss. England have Davies opening, would they want him to crack a century? Would make the selectors look plenty silly.
Tait to Strauss, no run whoosh, Tait starts very quickly and it's left alone outside off stump
Tait to Trott, no run fired in a touch shorter and Trott shuffles across his stumps to drop to leg
Tait to Trott, 1 wide and this is slung too wide of off. Guess that will happen with him every now and then
Tait to Trott, 1 run Trott opens the face and steers this past point for a jogged single
Tait to Davies, 1 wide Davies watches his first ball go down the leg side
Tait to Davies, no run ooh, Davies has been out of the game for a while and this was a sleepy drive outside off that swung back between bat and pad
Tait to Davies, no run touch shorter this time and Davies sways inside the line to flag it through to Haddin
Bollinger to Trott, no run Bollinger starts well enough outside off stump that is left all alone
Bollinger to Trott, 1 leg bye Trott shuffles across his stumps and a short ball is flicked off the hip to fine leg
Bollinger to Davies, no run this is dug in very short indeed and it leaps past Davies who left alone. No wide given
Bollinger to Davies, 1 wide touch of swing here, from the bowler and from the batsman, who aimed an airy drive and missed it. This was given a wide, which is a touch harsh
Bollinger to Davies, no run this is shorter and moved away off the seam and left alone
Bollinger to Davies, no run Davies gets bat on ball, without much timing, driven to cover
Tait to Pietersen, no run Pietersen gets a bouncer first ball that whistles past the nose
Tait to Pietersen, 1 run very sharp swinging full ball that Pietersen toe-ended square of the wicket
Tait to Trott, 1 wide shoved down the leg side this time. Quick though
Tait to Trott, no run slower ball this time, Trott happily pats it to midwicket. Full toss in the end perhaps Trott should have done more with it
Tait to Trott, no run very good length and line and Trott defends under his eyes
Tait to Trott, 1 wide pace and width draws Trott into a flat-footed waft outside off which he misses
Tait to Trott, 1 wide it's another wide, slung down the leg side
Tait to Trott, no run variation straight delivery, very straight and full and had Trott stuck on the back foot
Tait to Trott, no run good delivery here to finish the over, fullish and swinging away. Solidly blocked to mid-off
Bollinger to Pietersen, 1 wide good lord, another wide. Bollinger bangs this in short of a length and down the leg side
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run left alone outside off stump this time, but it's close enough to off stump to prevent a wide
Bollinger to Pietersen, 1 run fuller and straighter and carefully blocked, the inside edge carries it around the corner for one
Bollinger to Trott, 1 run Trott without fuss picks up a single dabbing into the midwicket region
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run ooh, good ball, nipped back from a length as Pietersen lunged forward and crashed into the elbow of the bottom arm
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run after all that alarm last delivery Pietersen decides to leave this alone outside off

Bollinger to Pietersen, no run ah, there's the silly shot, Pietersen walks across his stumps and aims a swish to the midwicket boundary. He missed and it crashed into the body. I suppose if he nailed it, it would have been a great shot
Tait to Trott, 3 runs Trott clips a full ball straight of midwicket for three
Tait to Pietersen, 2 runs bit of width from Tait and Pietersen threw his arms at it, toe-ended a bit and it went airily through cover
Tait to Pietersen, 2 runs bit more bat on this drive, still not timed perfectly and it goes through point for a couple more
Tait to Pietersen, 1 wide this is yet another wide, banged in short and down the leg side. Pietersen had an almighty thwack but missed
Tait to Pietersen, 1 wide wide, wide, wide, wide. Short and outside off this time. Pietersen ended up hopping on one leg to aim a swish to off but couldn't reach it
Tait to Pietersen, FOUR runs close enough for Pietersen this time to smash a widish offside delivery for four through cover
Tait to Pietersen, no run Pietersen is playing like a millionaire. He's having a bash at absolutely everything. Again he's missed it, clever slower ball dribbled through to Haddin
Tait to Pietersen, FOUR runs ah, full half-volley on leg stump and Pietersen clips it powerfully wide of mid-on for four
Bollinger to Trott, 2 runs Trott runs outside leg stump and Bollinger follows him, he still manages to squeeze it out over point for a couple
Bollinger to Trott, no run orthodoxy returns with Bollinger finding a decent length and line and is steered to point
Bollinger to Trott, no run Trott charging down the wicket again and Bollinger follows him again and the drive finds cover
Bollinger to Trott, no run dabbed this time to point
Bollinger to Trott, 1 run Trott shuffles across his stumps and fiddles this to square leg
Bollinger to Pietersen, 1 run Bollinger lands it on a tight line and Pietersen's attempted cut comes off a bottom edge close to the stumps
Johnson to Pietersen, 2 runs straight ball on a length is worked through midwicket, with the help of a misfield, for a couple
Johnson to Pietersen, no run excellent start from Johnson, very straight and Pietersen is uncomfortable with defence
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run fuller this time and driven without much timing down the ground for a gentle single. Calmer shot from Pietersen
Johnson to Trott, no run banged in short, short enough to be called a bouncer, but not a wide
Johnson to Trott, FOUR runs ah, fuller and the width Trott needs to stroke past point, with plenty of timing and it runs away for four
Johnson to Trott, no run Trott aims a cut shot that finds point, they batsmen went for a single and if Paine had hit, Trott, who had to turn back in a hurry would have gone
Bollinger to Pietersen, FOUR runs short and Pietersen climbed into a pull shot, got most of it and it flew out one-bounce to the midwicket rope
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run this is straighter and fuller and Pietersen defends
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run shorter this time but Pietersen was advancing and he has to get on his toes to defend

Bollinger to Pietersen, no run Pietersen again charging down the crease, Bollinger banged it in shorter and it ended up being driven straight back at him, Bollinger collected and missed as he aimed to throw down the stumps
Bollinger to Pietersen, 1 run driven again with a flurry of arms and legs and not much timing down to mid-on
Bollinger to Trott, 1 run Trott stays deep in his crease and works a single to midwicket
Johnson to Trott, no run very straight ball finds a very straight bat back to the bowler
Johnson to Trott, 1 run enough width for Trott to dab to third man
Johnson to Pietersen, no run Pietersen stands very still and throws his arms into a drive that dribbles to mid-off
Johnson to Pietersen, no run Pietersen is beaten again outside off stump, aiming a wafty drive
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run this time he does manage to get bat on ball to a length ball outside off stump, driven to mid-off
Bollinger to Pietersen, 1 run Pietersen fiddles this off his pads around the corner for a single to bring the new batsman Ian Bell on strike
Bollinger to Bell, 1 run Bell gets a shorter ball that he pulls gently down to fine leg
Bollinger to Pietersen, 1 run fuller ball to Pietersen, who has calmed down a wee bit after a frantic start, and drives to mid-off
Bollinger to Bell, FOUR runs just a hint of width and Bell times an elegant cut shot that speeds to the point boundary
Bollinger to Bell, no run this time Bollinger is straighter and Bell defends with the straightest of blades
Bollinger to Bell, no run again Bollinger is very straight and Bell can do nothing but defend
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 wide very full, very wide, Pietersen grunted as he tried to reach it with a flat-footed swish
Johnson to Pietersen, no run straighter this time and Pietersen stands tall to defend conventionally
Johnson to Pietersen, no run left alone! That's the first sensible shot outside off from Pietersen I can remember
Johnson to Pietersen, no run oh dear, this is a full ball that Pietersen aims a pull at, through him in a flash
Johnson to Pietersen, no run wider and fuller and Pietersen toe-ends a drive to mid-off. This is quite a struggle
Johnson to Prior, no run Matt Prior keeps his first ball out by patting to point
Hastings to Bell, no run starts outside off stump and Bell shoulders arms
Hastings to Bell, no run on a length and good line, Bell defends
Hastings to Bell, 1 run Hastings offers enough room for Bell to dab to third man
Hastings to Prior, no run Hastings finds a very straight line and Prior defends again
Hastings to Prior, 1 run Prior is away, nudging into the leg side for a swift single
Hastings to Bell, no run Bell lunges forward to a full and straight ball to defend
Johnson to Prior, no run Johnson is full and straight, as is Prior's bat
Johnson to Prior, no run this is very straight but a touch shorter and Prior steers a defence to point
Johnson to Prior, 1 run Prior nudges a single to square leg
Johnson to Bell, no run Bell tries to work this to leg but gets a hint of leading edge and it runs back to the bowler
Johnson to Bell, 1 wide some rare amusement for the few England fans at the ground as Johnson slings this miles past off
Johnson to Bell, no run banged in shorter, much shorter, it was down the legside but not given a wide
Johnson to Bell, no run left alone outside off stump to end the over
Hastings to Prior, 1 run Hastings continues to find a very good line and Bell can only defend
Hastings to Bell, no run outside off stump this time and Bell opens the face to guide it to third man
Hastings to Bell, 1 run pushed firmly into the covers for a swift single
Hastings to Prior, 1 run carefully pushed into the off side
Hastings to Bell, no run Bell down the wicket and pulling airily but it heads out one-bounce to deep midwicket
Hastings to Bell, 1 run
Johnson to Prior, no run this is pushed out into the covers
Johnson to Prior, no run another solid and sturdy defence from Prior
Johnson to Prior, no run Prior is beaten outside off stump, dangling his bat as it angles past the bat
Johnson to Prior, no run Prior is more solidly behind this one
Johnson to Prior, 1 run finally Prior gets one away, standing tall to steer to third man
Hastings to Prior, no run defended back down the pitch
Hastings to Prior, no run ah, a bottom edge now runs on to the pad, and he's lucky it didn't then run on to the stumps
Hastings to Prior, 1 run banged in short and Prior goes for the hook, Paul Reiffel at square leg ducks with admirable agility, and that's collected out in the deep
Hastings to Yardy, 1 run clipped off the pads for a single behind square, and Yardy's off the mark
Hastings to Prior, no run the lack of pace fools Prior here as he tries to punch a cover-drive off the back foot, can only get another bottom edge down to his feet
Hastings to Prior, 1 wide the slower bouncer now from Hastings, but it's also the wider bouncer - way outside off
Hastings to Prior, no run Prior goes for the cut, and can't beat point
Tait to Yardy, 1 run Yardy is greeted with a Tait bouncer, and does well to fend it to fine leg for a single
Tait to Prior, no run beautiful yorker! Quick and straight, but Prior is up to the task and jams it out, nearly falling over himself in doing so, but he survives
Tait to Prior, 1 run fast and straight again, and Prior punches a square drive through point
Tait to Yardy, 1 run on the stumps again and Yardy nudges a single to midwicket
Tait to Prior, 1 run soft hands from Prior as he pushes a single to the leg side
Tait to Yardy, no run Yardy goes for the dab cut now and finds point
Hastings to Prior, 2 runs fullish from Hastings and wide of off, Prior drives uppishly through cover to Ferguson, who is sweeping the boundary
Hastings to Prior, 1 run and again Prior punches a cover drive through the gap, but hits this one too well and can only get a single
Hastings to Yardy, no run beaten outside off as Yardy tries to push at a ball that angles across him
Hastings to Yardy, 1 leg bye struck on the pads on leg stump and half a shout for lbw from Hastings, but that must certainly have pitched outside leg
Hastings to Prior, 1 run Prior won't mind a bouncer from Hastings, who isn't that quick, and he hooks it on the bounce to deep square leg
Hastings to Yardy, 1 wide wrong line, down leg and Asad Rauf calls that a wide
Hastings to Yardy, no run Yardy leans in to an off-drive and can't find a gap at mid-off
Tait to Prior, no run another ripping yorker and it's right on line, but again Prior is good enough to keep it out
Tait to Prior, FOUR runs lovely shot! Just enough width from Tait, and Prior uses the pace to push a drive through the gap at cover, just timing it and placing it to perfection
Tait to Prior, no run nudged into the ground and gully does the fielding
Tait to Prior, 1 run Prior does get this one fine enough to beat gully, guiding it off the back foot to third man
Tait to Yardy, no run Tait goes for the yorker but this one is just outside off, and Yardy doesn't get bat on ball. If Tait gets a yorker on line to Yardy, it could be goodnight.
Tait to Yardy, 1 wide nope, wide ball as Tait sprays this one down leg
Tait to Yardy, 1 run banged in short of a length and Yardy uses the pace to steer this one behind gully for a single
Krejza to Yardy, 1 run Krejza is around the wicket to Yardy, drifts it in nicely and Yardy nudges it away to leg
Krejza to Prior, 2 runs Krejza flights it again and Prior goes for the dab sweep back over his left shoulder, fine leg runs around to field
Krejza to Prior, 1 run a paddle away through square leg now
Krejza to Yardy, 1 run Yardy punches a single through cover - not a lot of turn for Krejza, he's getting some drift though
Krejza to Prior, no run some spin this time, and Prior gets it off the hip to short fine leg
Krejza to Prior, 1 run Prior waits on this and plays it late, cutting fine
Hastings to Prior, no run pushed away to the off side

Hastings to Prior, no run beaten outside off. Or is it? Hastings appeals enthusiastically, as does the captain White, although Haddin isn't that interested. Prior tried to dab it away and there must have been a noise. Anyway, White wants a review. Hot Spot doesn't seem to have shown anything, and the not-out decision

Hastings to Prior, 1 wide bouncer a little down leg now and Prior misses his hook - that's called a wide, the indication coming from square-leg for the height of that ball, which was a touch above the head
Hastings to Prior, 1 run good cut from Prior, who gets a single through point

Hastings to Yardy, 1 run oooh, a run-out chance here as Yardy nudges to off and is slow to react to Prior's call - Hussey from gully collects and throws, but Yardy manages to get his body between the ball and the stumps, so it's hit him on the back of the legs. He might have been short had that got through and hit the
Hastings to Prior, FOUR runs an inside edge through the gate now from Prior, who is lucky not to have played on, but instead he picks up a useful boundary
Hastings to Prior, 1 run on the back foot now, Prior steers it to third man
Krejza to Prior, FOUR runs Prior goes for the reverse sweep and he gets it right off the middle of the bat, also getting it fine enough to beat third man
Krejza to Prior, no run tossed up on line and Prior pushes it back to Krejza
Krejza to Prior, 2 runs plenty of flight again from Krejza, and a little wide of off, Prior drives hard through cover
Krejza to Prior, 1 run soft hands from Prior, as he clips it with the spin towards long on
Krejza to Yardy, 2 runs ah, just too short from Krejza as he tried to rip this and get a lot of spin, Yardy punches it forward of cover point
Krejza to Yardy, 1 run and again Yardy cuts through the off side with the spin
Hastings to Yardy, no run left alone outside off
Hastings to Yardy, no run cramps Yardy for room and he misses his attempted cut

Hastings to Yardy, 1 run Yardy gets away with one now, as he tries to hook Hastings and gets a top edge down to fine leg, it looks as though it may carry to Johnson, but in the end it falls a few metres short of him
Hastings to Prior, no run driven back to Hastings
Hastings to Prior, 1 run angling on to the pads of Prior, who clips a run through midwicket
Hastings to Yardy, no run full and straight, and Yardy defends safely
Krejza to Prior, no run ah! That's what happens when you don't get the reverse sweep right. The ball spins too much for Prior, and runs off his forearm up into his helmet
Krejza to Prior, no run defended back to Krejza
Krejza to Prior, 1 run Prior clips this with the spin through square leg
Krejza to Yardy, no run plenty of air from Krejza, and Yardy advances to make it a full toss, in the end just pushing it back to the bowler
Krejza to Yardy, 1 run too short, and Yardy has no trouble crunching it through cover
Krejza to Prior, 1 run again it's too short, Prior muscles a pull through square leg, but he probably could have done better with that and found a gap
Hastings to Prior, 1 run Prior drives comfortably through cover for another single
Hastings to Yardy, 1 run Yardy this time finds the gap at cover, just getting himself another single
Hastings to Prior, no run bouncer time, and Prior tries to swipe a hook away but can't connect
Hastings to Prior, 1 run half-volley from Hastings, and Prior just steers a drive through cover, happy to tick the scoreboard along with ones and twos
Hastings to Yardy, 2 runs fullish and straight, and Yardy closes the face to work this through midwicket and they pick up two to Paine in the deep
Hastings to Yardy, no run left alone outside off
Krejza to Wright, 2 runs a bit too short from Krejza, but Wright can only tickle it down the leg side to fine leg

Krejza to Wright, no run oh, a run-out chance goes begging! Wright worked it around the corner to leg, the batsmen took off and then both turned back as Paine got across quickly from short midwicket, but in his dive to the ball Paine has fumbled it and doesn't get his throw away
Krejza to Wright, FOUR runs ah, bad ball. Wright latches quickly on to a short one and thumps a pull through square leg for a boundary
Krejza to Wright, FOUR runs and again Krejza drags it down, and again Wright's eyes light up and he pulls hard through square leg for another four
Krejza to Wright, 1 run better ball, fuller and outside off, and Wright cuts late
Tait to Wright, no run Wright cuts, and it's well fielded at gully
Tait to Wright, no run again Wright tries to cut but Tait is just too quick, it's an under edge that dribbles away to slip
Tait to Wright, FOUR runs lovely shot from Wright as Tait gives him a half-volley, and it's pushed through cover point without much flair but with excellent timing. Good shot.
Tait to Wright, no run and Tait responds with a bouncer! Wright wants nothing to do with a well-directed bumper at 145kph, and he ducks it.
Tait to Wright, no run again it's a bouncer - and at 151kph mind you! Wright did try to slap a pull away but was never quick enough on that shot, and Haddin did well to make the take
Tait to Wright, (no ball) horrid delivery from Tait, a full toss down leg side which would have been wide, but worse for Australia it's actually a front-foot no-ball, which means a free hit
Tait to Wright, 2 runs Tait goes for the slower bouncer, and Wright flays at his free hit, lobbing it up over point but not quite timing it
Krejza to Yardy, 1 run Yardy has time again as Krejza is just a touch too short, and it's cut away safely
Krejza to Wright, 1 run tossed up outside off and turning in, but again it's not full enough, and Wright waits to cut it through cover point
Krejza to Yardy, 1 run nudged away through point again
Krejza to Wright, 1 run Wright tucks it away behind square leg, again it was too short
Krejza to Yardy, no run that's a better ball, fuller and drifting in, Yardy plays it from the crease, defending
Krejza to Yardy, no run defended away to the off side now
Hussey to Wright, 1 run tossed up invitingly and Wright actually times a drive
Hussey to Yardy, no run driven carefully to cover
Hussey to Yardy, no run touch of air again and pushed to cover
Hussey to Yardy, 1 run this is very straight and turned into the leg side
Hussey to Wright, 2 runs some width from Hussey allows Wright to slash backwards of square
Hussey to Wright, 1 run flat just outside off, Wright taps it softly to point, takes a quick single
Krejza to Wright, 1 run Wright gets deep into his crease to guide a slightly shortish ball wide of cover
Krejza to Yardy, 1 run short again and cut out to deep point
Krejza to Plunkett, 1 run pushed to backwards square
Krejza to Yardy, 1 run played backwards of square on the off side for a single
Krejza to Plunkett, no run Plunkett lunges forward to defend carefully
Johnson to Yardy, no run Johnson returns and fires this into Yard's pads
Johnson to Yardy, no run this is up outside off stump and it's left all alone
Johnson to Yardy, no run full, straight and crashed into Yardy's pads. It looked very straight by the umpire wasn't interested and the Aussies don't fancy a referral
Johnson to Yardy, no run Yardy opts this time to leave alone outside off
Johnson to Yardy, 1 wide this is slung down the leg side and Yardy can't connect with his attempted fiddle
Johnson to Yardy, 1 wide this is down the leg side again, further than the last
Johnson to Yardy, no run this is straight and pushed down to mid-on
Johnson to Yardy, 1 run full and tucked around the corner for single
Krejza to Yardy, 2 runs Krejza gives this plenty of air, but it's down the leg side and past the keeper and Tait has to give chase
Krejza to Yardy, no run this is straighter and defended
Krejza to Yardy, no run touch quicker and flatter and again careful defence
Krejza to Yardy, no run back cut from outside off speeds to short third man
Krejza to Yardy, 1 run Yardy pushes to midwicket and sets off for a very tight single
Krejza to Plunkett, 1 run Plunkett gets across his stumps to work this neatly onto the leg side for one
Johnson to Plunkett, no run Johnson lands an absolute pearler, reverse-swinging away past a hapless Plunkett outside edge
Johnson to Plunkett, 1 run this is a touch shorter and Plunkett gets precious bat on ball guiding to deep third man
Johnson to Yardy, 1 run more reverse swing at a yorker length this time and Yardy jabs it away
Johnson to Plunkett, no run beaten again outside off. Plunkett prods forward and it speeds past the outside edge
Johnson to Plunkett, no run this time Plunkett decides he's better off leaving alone. Johnson is bowling rather well here

Johnson to Plunkett, no run more swing, late and bending away late, it's through Plunkett, getting a pad on its way through to Haddin. Given out by caught but Plunkett reviewed straight away and it was heading over, so can't be lbw and missed the bat, so can't be caught. Great delivery though, Johnson is a man transfo
Krejza to Yardy, 1 run little bit short here so even with a fraction of spin and back-foot drive through point is easy
Krejza to Plunkett, no run fuller here and pushed to mid-on
Krejza to Plunkett, 1 run too short and Plunkett unfurls a strong pull shot that is fielded smartly on the square-leg boundary
Krejza to Yardy, no run nudged around the corner but straight to the fielder
Krejza to Yardy, 1 wide short and down the legside for another wide
Krejza to Yardy, 1 run this is dabbed out backwards of square on the off side
Krejza to Plunkett, no run turned around the corner but no single available
Hussey to Yardy, 1 run Yardy swishes a drive through cover
Hussey to Plunkett, no run for no particular reason Plunkett misses a prod outside off stump
Hussey to Plunkett, 1 run Plunkett down the wicket but only to check-drive to long-off
Hussey to Yardy, no run this is shoved down the leg side and flicks a pad
Hussey to Yardy, 2 runs Yardy gives himself some room to chop down to deep point
Hussey to Yardy, no run defended with firm wrists to cover
Krejza to Plunkett, SIX runs Plunkett, like many of us, has had enough and slugs this high over long-on for six
Krejza to Plunkett, no run this time he defends carefully
Krejza to Plunkett, no run some extra spin defeats the attempted defence and it runs off the pads
Krejza to Plunkett, 1 run attempted sweep shot goes off the top edge and loops safely towards short fine leg
Krejza to Yardy, no run Yardy can't get this away, defending a fullish ball
Krejza to Yardy, no run down the leg side, attempted sweep finds arm so prevents a wide
Hussey to Plunkett, no run outside off stump and missed by Plunkett
Hussey to Plunkett, 1 run this is leg-sided and Plunkett works it very firmly to deep square
Hussey to Yardy, no run Yardy aims a dab sweep but not for the first time he misses
Hussey to Yardy, 1 run this time Yardy stays up and pushes to cover
Hussey to Plunkett, 1 run Plunkett on the dab sweep now, completing it far better than Yardy to collect a single
Hussey to Yardy, no run Yardy down the wicket and Hussey fires it in quicker but Haddin spills the take
Hastings to Plunkett, no run good start from Hastings, on a length at off stump and defended to cover
Hastings to Plunkett, no run flash and a miss outside off stump. No real reason for Plunkett to have missed it, but he did
Hastings to Plunkett, 2 runs very delicate late dab from off stump guides this through first slip. Actually rather well played
Hastings to Plunkett, 1 run slower bouncer comes off the back of the bat and loops down to fine leg
Hastings to Yardy, no run shortish and cut straight to backwards point
Hastings to Yardy, 2 runs Yardy gets away with another false-shot, he tried to flick this into the midwicket stands but it came off a top edge and looped into space
Hussey to Plunkett, 1 run this is flat and Plunkett pushes to cover with soft, soft hands for a single
Hussey to Yardy, 1 run flat and quick again and Yardy flicks it around the corner
Hussey to Plunkett, no run this is defended back to the bowler
Hussey to Plunkett, no run firmly driven but straight to cover
Hussey to Plunkett, no run Plunkett picks out mid-on with a flick
Hussey to Plunkett, 2 runs Plunkett fetches this from outside off and shoves it to deep midwicket for a well-run couple
Bollinger to Yardy, no run Yardy backs away and aims to cut over third man but misses
Bollinger to Yardy, FOUR runs Yardy gives himself room and this time hacks it over the cover ring for four
Bollinger to Yardy, no run Yardy is backing away again, Bollinger follows him and Yardy had to change his shot to a leg-side smack, which he timed well but straight to mid-on
Bollinger to Yardy, FOUR runs Yardy lands another blow! Getting back in his crease to smack over third man for four
Bollinger to Yardy, 2 runs Yardy runs outside leg, then comes back and swishes a couple behind square on the leg side
Bollinger to Yardy, no run Yardy backing away again and Bollinger followed and Yardy couldn't get this away
Tait to Plunkett, no run bouncer, and Plunkett can't get bat on ball
Tait to Plunkett, no run Plunket has a slash at one outside off and again it beats the bat
Tait to Finn, no run Finn is in now, and he backs away as Tait follows him with a short ball
Tait to Finn, no run wide of off now and Finn breathes a sigh of relief as he's allowed to leave it alone
Bollinger to Yardy, 2 runs Yardy throws the bat at this pull and gets just enough on it to clear the infield

Bollinger to Yardy, 2 runs oh well played! Yardy has smashed this straight back at the bowler, and Bollinger did well to get his head out of the way, so hard was that struck. He had no chance to get the hands up for a catch, and Krejza at mid-off only just saves it
Bollinger to Yardy, FOUR runs this one is misdirected, down leg and Yardy has managed to get a little tickle on that to get a boundary at fine leg, and that's a good half-century from Yardy

Bollinger to Yardy, SIX runs and all of a sudden Yardy has pulled Bollinger for six! What a good shot, he's connected well with this and cleared the rope comfortably, and that's Yardy's highest ODI score
Bollinger to Yardy, 1 leg bye slower ball now, and Yardy doesn't pick it, trying to clear the leg side again, and it thumps him in the chest
Bollinger to Anderson, no run good ball, full and straight, but Anderson is good enough to keep it out
Tait to Yardy, no run Yardy backs away and as a result can't reach this full toss that Tait sprays wide of off
Tait to Yardy, no run punched away to the off side
Tait to Yardy, 1 run again Yardy backs away and Tait follows him, he swivels a pull through midwicket
Tait to Anderson, no run Tait tries for the yorker but it's well wide of off
Tait to Anderson, 1 wide banged in at the hips, but a touch too leg-sidey and that's a wide
Tait to Anderson, no run Tait goes for the slower ball now, and it's well wide of off, Anderson can't get bat on ball
Tait to Anderson, no run this one sizzles through at 148kph, fortunately for Anderson it was just outside off and he could leave it
Hastings to Yardy, no run slower ball to start with and Yardy punches it to long-off, declining a single
Hastings to Yardy, no run the slower bouncer this time - 102kph, that's almost Yardy's own bowling speed! - and he couldn't get any bat on ball
Hastings to Yardy, 1 run Yardy swipes a slog out to deep midwicket on the bounce
Hastings to Anderson, no run almost a wicket! Anderson gives himself room and slashes on the up to point, and the ball bounces just short of Tim Paine
Hastings to Anderson, FOUR runs this time Anderson finds the gap at point, and that's a lovely cut to get himself off the mark with a boundary

Thanks for joining us throughout this series, and do tune in again when these two teams begin their World Cup campaigns later this month. On behalf of all the commentators throughout this series - Sahil Dutta, Liam Brickhill and George Binoy - this is Brydon Coverdale signing off.

That's it from a massive summer of international cricket in Australia. Andrew Strauss and his men have lost this series, but they should take a bow for the thrashing that they gave Australia in the Ashes. Andrew McGlashan has been covering this ODI series for us, and his bulletin can be found here.

Adam Voges is the Man of the Match for his excellent unbeaten 80, a career-best that will ensure he is in the mix should any opportunities arise through injuries to Australian batsmen at the World Cup. Watson is the Player of the Series. And Cameron White begins his ODI captaincy career with a victory.

So, Australia have won by 57 runs, and they've totally dominated this one-day series. England fly home tomorrow night for a few days with their families before they pack their bags again and head to the World Cup.
Australia won by 57 runs
Player of the match is Adam Voges, AUS
